abstract_summ: Although COVID-19 manifests primarily as respiratory disease, few cases of cardiac injury without respiratory involvement or febrile illness have been reported.With the global pandemic, more cases are emerging regarding myocardial injury induced by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) virus.This case showed that acute myocarditis can be the initial presentation of patients with COVID-19 infection.Two COVID-19 cases in our report exhibited different ECG manifestations as the disease caused deterioration.Herein is presented a case of a 71 year-old woman with mild SARS-CoV2 respiratory infection who experienced acute myopericarditis diagnosed by clinical, biological, ECG data and cardiac magnetic resonance imaging.
